seniority_level.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Senior Data Engineer' with 4+ years experience requirement, which aligns with senior level in IC hierarchy

job_family.evidence: Title is 'Data Engineer' and core responsibilities focus on data pipelines, orchestration, storage infrastructure, and data workflows

sub_specialty.evidence: Primary focus on ETL/ELT, data orchestration tools (Dagster, Airflow, Prefect), and data warehousing technologies (AWS Athena) with batch processing patterns

leadership_expectation.evidence: Mentions contributing to team formation and partnering with data producers across the organization, indicating technical leadership without direct reports

primary_cloud.evidence: AWS mentioned explicitly as primary cloud platform with specific services like AWS Athena, and listed first among cloud options

secondary_clouds.evidence: Azure and GCP mentioned as alternative cloud platforms alongside AWS, indicating multi-cloud familiarity is valued

processing_paradigm.evidence: Primary focus on ETL/ELT workflows, data pipelines, and batch processing with streaming technologies only mentioned as nice-to-have

orchestrator_category.evidence: Experience with data orchestration tools like Dagster, Airflow, or Prefect explicitly required, focusing on modern orchestrator platforms

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions both data warehousing (AWS Athena) and datalake technologies with modern table formats (JSON, Avro, Parquet, Iceberg) indicating lakehouse architecture

remote_restriction.evidence: Hybrid work model requires being in Boston, MA area for 2 core days per week, indicating regional presence required

timezone_focus.evidence: Boston, MA location with US-only restriction suggests Americas timezone focus, though no specific timezone requirements stated

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requiring presence in Boston office 2 days per week suggests relocation may be needed if not already in the Boston area

h1b_friendly.evidence: No mention of visa sponsorship in job posting, and silence on sponsorship typically indicates no H1B support available

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visa support (OPT/CPT) and focus on experienced professionals with 4+ years suggests no student visa friendly

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship requirements mentioned, implying standard work authorization requirement without specific citizenship constraints

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent employment with comprehensive benefits package strongly indicates W2 employee status

benefits_level.evidence: Extensive benefits including equity, annual bonus, medical, retirement, wellness, lifestyle benefits, and unique perks like free security system

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'learning and growth are continuous' and opportunities to 'build, grow and thrive' but no specific career progression paths detailed

mentorship_signals.evidence: Collaborative environment mentioned with team formation contributions and cross-functional partnerships, but no formal mentorship program stated

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit promotion or advancement path mentioned in job description or requirements

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or role changes within the organization

career_tracks_available.evidence: No specific career tracks (IC, management, specialist, architect) mentioned in job posting

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between must-have and nice-to-have skills with balanced requirements - not overly strict but substantial

scope_definition.evidence: Focused job description specifically for Senior Data Engineer role with well-defined responsibilities and clear scope

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: 4+ years experience requirement for senior level is reasonable, and skills listed are appropriate for the seniority level without unrealistic combinations
